content:
All starting materials Na2CO3 (≥99.5%),and GdF3 (99.9%) were analytical grade from commercial sources and used without further treatment.

Synthesis of NaGdCO<sub>3</sub>F<sub>2</sub> (<bold>1</bold>)

A mixture of Na2CO3 (0.318 g, 3 mmol) and GdF3 (0.214g, 1 mmol) were added to deionized water (5 mL). The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 20 min (pH = 12), sealed into a 23 mL Teflon autoclave, heated at 220 °C for 6 days, and then slowly cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h, which is beneficial to obtain high quality crystals for single crystal structure determination. Cooling too fast may lead to twined crystal of poor quality. The products were washed with deionized water and then dried in air. Transparent stick crystals of NaGdCO3F2 shown in Figure S1a were obtained in yields of about 71% (on the basis of Gd).

Synthesis of Na<sub>2</sub>GdCO<sub>3</sub>F<sub>3</sub> (<bold>2</bold>)

Na2GdCO3F3 was hydrothermally synthesized by reactions of a mixture of Na2CO3 (0.531 g, 5 mmol), GdF3 (0.214 g, 1 mmol), and deionized water (5 mL). Then the mixture was sealed in a 23 mL Teflon autoclave (pH = 12) and heated at 220 °C for 6 days, and slow cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h. The transparent products were obtained and washed with deionized water, and dried in air. The crystals shown in Figure S1b were collected in yields of about 81% (on the basis of Gd).

Synthesis of Na<sub>3</sub>Gd­(CO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>3</sub> (<bold>3</bold>)

A mixture of Na2CO3 (0.424 g, 4 mmol), GdF3 (0.107 g, 0.5 mmol), and deionized water (5 mL) with a pH value about 12 was sealed in an autoclave equipped with a Teflon liner (23 mL), heated at 220 °C for 6 days, and then slow cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h. Transparent plate crystals of Na3Gd­(CO3)3 shown in Figure S1c were obtained in yields of about 34% (on the basis of Gd).

Synthesis of Na<sub>3</sub>Gd­(CO<sub>3</sub>)<sub>3</sub>·6H<sub>2</sub>O (<bold>4</bold>)

A mixture of Na2CO3 (3.392 g, 32 mmol), GdF3(0.856g, 4 mmol) was added to the 5 mL deionized water and stirring for about 20 min. The resulting solution was sealed in a 23 mL Teflon autoclave (pH = 12), and heated at 220 °C for 6 days and then slow cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h. The colorless block crystals shown in Figure S1d were obtained in yields of about 48% (on the basis of Gd).

Thermal Analysis

Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was conducted on a Netzsch STA 409 PC. The crystal samples (10–15 mg) were enclosed in platinum crucibles and heated from room temperature to 800 °C at a rate of 10 °C/min under a constant flow of air gas.
clean_text:
Experimental Section

Synthesis

All starting materials Na2CO3 (≥99.5%),and GdF3 (99.9%) were analytical grade from commercial sources and used without further treatment.

Synthesis of NaGdCO3F2 (1)

A mixture of Na2CO3 (0.318 g, 3 mmol) and GdF3 (0.214g, 1 mmol) were added to deionized water (5 mL). The mixture was stirred at room temperature for 20 min (pH = 12), sealed into a 23 mL Teflon autoclave, heated at 220 °C for 6 days, and then slowly cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h, which is beneficial to obtain high quality crystals for single crystal structure determination. Cooling too fast may lead to twined crystal of poor quality. The products were washed with deionized water and then dried in air. Transparent stick crystals of NaGdCO3F2 shown in Figure S1a were obtained in yields of about 71% (on the basis of Gd).

Synthesis of Na2GdCO3F3 (2)

Na2GdCO3F3 was hydrothermally synthesized by reactions of a mixture of Na2CO3 (0.531 g, 5 mmol), GdF3 (0.214 g, 1 mmol), and deionized water (5 mL). Then the mixture was sealed in a 23 mL Teflon autoclave (pH = 12) and heated at 220 °C for 6 days, and slow cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h. The transparent products were obtained and washed with deionized water, and dried in air. The crystals shown in Figure S1b were collected in yields of about 81% (on the basis of Gd).

Synthesis of Na3Gd(CO3)3 (3)

A mixture of Na2CO3 (0.424 g, 4 mmol), GdF3 (0.107 g, 0.5 mmol), and deionized water (5 mL) with a pH value about 12 was sealed in an autoclave equipped with a Teflon liner (23 mL), heated at 220 °C for 6 days, and then slow cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h. Transparent plate crystals of Na3Gd(CO3)3 shown in Figure S1c were obtained in yields of about 34% (on the basis of Gd).

Synthesis of Na3Gd(CO3)3⋅6H2O (4)

A mixture of Na2CO3 (3.392 g, 32 mmol), GdF3(0.856g, 4 mmol) was added to the 5 mL deionized water and stirring for about 20 min. The resulting solution was sealed in a 23 mL Teflon autoclave (pH = 12), and heated at 220 °C for 6 days and then slow cooled to ambient temperature at a rate of 3 °C/h. The colorless block crystals shown in Figure S1d were obtained in yields of about 48% (on the basis of Gd).

Thermal Analysis

Thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) was conducted on a Netzsch STA 409 PC. The crystal samples (10-15 mg) were enclosed in platinum crucibles and heated from room temperature to 800 °C at a rate of 10 °C/min under a constant flow of air gas.
